adjective.description: (of two people) on even terms, especially because a debt or score has been settled.
examples: I think we're just about quits now, don't you?

phrases: take this check and we'll call it quits
surely, after covering eleven wars, he could be forgiven for calling it quits?
I feel better about the situation, just for the simple fact that she was the one who decided to call it quits.
Although he made an annual ritual of announcing his retirement only to change his mind, he decided to call it quits for good after earning his third World Championship ring in 1974.
We're just going to have to agree to disagree and call it quits.
origin: Late 15th century (in the sense freed from a liability or debt): perhaps a colloquial abbreviation of medieval Latin quittus, from Latin quietus, used as a receipt (see quietus).
